results.title: The Plantation system in southern life
results.brief_description: Social and economic development of a cultural pattern in southern United States is traced in this film. Life on a southern plantation is recreated so that historical scenes can be related to their modern counterpart. Presents information on the organisation of a plantation; economy as dominated by one crop - cotton; effect of the Civil War on the economy and the influence of the past on the life of southern people today.

results.title: The Plant
results.creator_credit: Helene Verrier, ONF | NFB and Thomas Vamos
results.brief_description: A live-action non-narrated story about a man who brings a plant, that had been struggling up through a crack in the pavement, into his apartment. The plant is lavished with kindness by its new owner, but has a mind of its own and soon grows out of control. It encroaches into all areas of the apartment, eventually damaging it beyond repair. An open-ended film allowing scope for language development.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Helene Verrier, ONF | NFB and Thomas Vamos

results.title: The Plank. Rhubarb rhubarb
results.creator_credit: Thames Television, Dennis Kirkland, David Clark and Eric Sykes
results.brief_description: The Plank is a classic silent comedy starring Eric Sykes and Arthur Lowe as two builders who find they are missing a floorboard. Untold confusion and mayhem follows as they travel across town with a replacement. Features almost every British comic actoar you can think of. “Rhubarb rhubarb” is another of Sykes’ comedies without words except for the occasional “rhubarb”. Eric Sykes is the Police Inspector whose passion in life is golf and, with the help of Jimmy Edwards tries to win no matter how. Bob Todd stars as the Vicar who is the only person left in the golf club who will play with the Inspector, but unfortunately he is a born loser.

results.title: The Planets
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Outlines the research and development of NASA, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration in the USA over the 13 years from 1961-1974. The significant findings of space missions and the techniques used to analyse information are dealt with. Scientists and astronauts involved discuss space exploration, the origins of the planets and the solar system. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Planets
results.creator_credit: BBC, Arts and Entertainment Network, Jacqueline Smith, Becky Jones, David McNab and James Younger
results.brief_description: This BBC documentary consists of eight episodes in the series, “The Planets” - Different worlds, Terra firma, Giants, Moon, Star, Atmosphere, Life and Destiny. Overall the series makes a detailed examination of the solar system using computer graphics, archival satellite footage and features interviews with various astronomers and scientific experts. Topics include revolutions and developments in philosophy and science through the ages as a reflection of our comprehension of the solar system. The series also covers developments in space travel and scientific discoveries that revolutionised approached to space, the results of which still reverberate today. Different worlds: Early attempts at space travel examined as well as the latest developments in space exploration. Terra firma: Geological information missions to neighbouring planets. Giants: Details the massive planets of Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. Moon: Explores theories regarding the moon’s domination of the earth’s tides. Also covers the years of the space race. Star: How the age of space exploration has garnered new scientific insights. Atmosphere: Describes the bizarre weather of other planets. Life: Poses the question, Are we alone? Destiny: Explains evolution over the next billion years. An intelligent and engaging documentary.

results.title: The Plan
results.creator_credit: Bescher Films, Dianne Orr and C Larry Roberts
results.brief_description: Features Michele Meservy, Utah’s Young Mother of the Year for 1978. Follows this intelligent and committed Mormon Mother through the rigours of her day, taking care of her five young children and husband, and reflecting on her life, obligations and spiritual destiny.

results.title: The Plague [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: Richard McRoberts, Country Education Project and Barry Washington
results.brief_description: A program which provides an analysis of the novel “The Plague” by Albert Camus, some comments on symbolism found in it and some stimulus for further discussion. Discusses the life and philosophy of Camus with reference to the novel; various subject levels of the novel; narrative structure and characters.

results.title: The Place at the coast (Captioned)
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1961, Ellie and her father travel to the seaside town of Kilkee for their annual holiday. For a time, the two enjoy their past routines - Ellie, a keen naturalist, observing and recording the native wildlife, her father fishing. However, a tourist development plan is proposed which will change their summer retreat, and Ellie soon learns that she is alone in her opposition to change. Cast includes John Hargreaves, Heather Mitchell, Tushka Bergen.
